GZ:
This place you don't want to be near after an atomic blast

SDI:
This system, aka Star Wars, intended to protect the U.S. from Soviet missiles

MAD:
This, severely damaging both sides in a nuclear war (that's why supposedly no one will start one)

APC:
These, like the M2 Bradley infantry fighting vehicle

NPT:
This type of treaty that aims to stop the spread of weapons

rounds.comments: (Alex: We will name a British show for you, and you have to tell us what was the American program that the Brits modeled their show on.)

clues.text: "Married For Life", which changed the Bundy name to Butler
"The upper hand", with Joe McGann in the Tony Danza widower role
"Brighton Belles", about 4 older gals in a Sussex country house
"Days Like These", also set decades ago & keeping Eric Forman as the lead's name
"The Fosters", in which immigrants from Guyana are scratching & surviving in south London, not Chicago

rounds.text: He played Shakespearean title characters 4 times, receiving Best Actor Oscar nominations each time
